intro: Knautia × chassagnei, commonly known as the hybrid meadow knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are palmately lobed, and it produces numerous small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. Knautia × chassagnei is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
